page.title: 06FARMER'S DAY-INCE BLUNDELL
page.content: The farmer's day has no set hours as the weather and the length of the day decide what can be done.The farmer told us about one day in July. The day begins at{5 a.m.}First the farmer has to check the irrigator and move it to another part of the field. After this, the animals are checked. At{7.30}the farmer sets the men to work and gives them their orders for the day. After breakfast there is office work to do and telephone calls to be made. From{8 a.m.}to lunch everyone is occupied lifting potatoes. from lunchtime to teatime the sugar beet must be weeded and the plants which have run to seed must be pulled out. About{5 p.m.}the cattle feed is checked.After tea, the irrigator must be moved again.
